name: Standard Auto Collision
description: Standard auto collision claim - should be approved
claim_text: I was in a car accident on November 20, 2025, at the intersection of Main Street and Oak Avenue. Another driver ran a red light and hit my vehicle on the driver's side. The damage is extensive - the door is crushed, the side mirror is broken, and there's significant frame damage. The repair shop estimated the cost at $8,500. My policy number is POL-AUTO-001. I've been a policyholder for 2 years with no prior claims. The police report number is PR-2025-11234. I need to get my car repaired as soon as possible as it's my primary transportation to work.

name: Home Water Damage
description: Home insurance claim for water damage - partial coverage
claim_text: Policy number POL-HOME-002. On November 15, 2025, a pipe burst in my second-floor bathroom causing significant water damage to the bathroom, hallway, and ceiling of the first floor. The water damaged the hardwood floors, drywall, and some furniture. A plumber came out and fixed the pipe immediately. The restoration company estimates $15,000 for repairs - $8,000 for structural repairs, $4,000 for flooring, and $3,000 for furniture replacement. I've been a policyholder for 18 months. Photos and contractor estimates are available upon request.

name: Health Emergency
description: Health insurance claim for emergency care - high value
claim_text: I'm submitting a claim under policy POL-HEALTH-003. On November 18, 2025, I experienced severe chest pain and was taken by ambulance to St. Mary's Hospital emergency room. After tests including EKG, blood work, and chest X-rays, I was diagnosed with a heart condition and admitted for 3 days of monitoring and treatment. The total hospital bill is $45,000 - $5,000 for emergency room, $25,000 for hospital stay, $10,000 for procedures, and $5,000 for medications. All care was medically necessary and pre-authorized by the attending physician Dr. James Wilson. I have all itemized bills and medical records.

name: Suspicious Auto Claim
description: Auto claim with fraud indicators - should flag for review
claim_text: Policy POL-AUTO-004. My car was damaged yesterday, November 25, 2025. I'm not exactly sure what happened but when I came out of the grocery store, there was damage to the rear bumper and trunk. No witnesses, no police report. The damage looks pretty bad. I'm claiming $12,000 for repairs. I just got this policy 2 weeks ago. The repair shop is my cousin's auto body shop and they said they can fix it quickly. I need the money urgently as I have financial difficulties. Can you approve this today? I've submitted two other claims in the past month for similar incidents at different locations.

name: Expired Policy Claim
description: Claim on expired policy - should be denied
claim_text: I need to file a claim for my car accident that happened on November 22, 2025. My policy number is POL-AUTO-005. I was involved in a collision on Highway 101 where another vehicle merged into my lane and sideswiped my car. There's damage to the passenger side doors and panels. The repair estimate is $6,500. I know my policy expired last year but I thought I had renewed it. Can you still process this claim? I've been a loyal customer for many years.

name: Home Theft Claim
claim_text: Policy number POL-HOME-002. On November 19, 2025, my home was burglarized while I was at work. The thieves broke in through the back door and stole electronics, jewelry, and other valuables. I filed a police report immediately (Report #BR-2025-8932). Items stolen include: a laptop ($1,500), TV ($800), jewelry ($3,200), and camera equipment ($2,500). Total claimed amount is $8,000. I have receipts for all items and photos from my home insurance inventory I did last year. The police collected fingerprints and are investigating. My deductible is $500.
